alert.note: Alert for Lee; Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 11 at 3:37PM CST until March 13 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT TO 10 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 on Saturday morning and 21 on Sunday morning expected. For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...Lee and Lowndes Counties. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight CST tonight to 10 AM CDT Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
